SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.search

Class SecuritySearchBuilder

java.lang.Object
grafioschtrader.search.SecuritycurrencySearchBuilder
grafioschtrader.search.SecuritySearchBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<Security>
public class SecuritySearchBuilder extends SecuritycurrencySearchBuilder implements org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<Security>
JPA Criteria API Specification implementation for comprehensive security searching.

This class builds dynamic queries to search for securities based on a wide variety of criteria while optionally excluding those already present in watchlists or correlation sets. It implements the Spring Data JPA Specification pattern to provide type-safe and composable query building for Security entities.

The search supports extensive filtering capabilities including:

  • Identification: ISIN, name, ticker symbol
  • Classification: Asset class type, investment instrument type, subcategory
  • Trading: Stock exchange, currency, active date ranges
  • Access: Tenant privacy, leverage factor, derived securities
  • Data feeds: Historical and intraday connector IDs
  • Exclusions: Items already in watchlists or correlation sets

SQL equivalent examples: SELECT s.name FROM security s where s.name LIKE "%Gold%" AND s.id_securitycurrency NOT IN (Select w.id_securitycurrency FROM watchlist_sec_cur w where w.id_watchlist = 7) SELECT s.name FROM security s where s.name LIKE "%Gold%" AND NOT EXISTS (Select null FROM watchlist_sec_cur w where w.id_watchlist = 7 AND s.id_securitycurrency = w.id_securitycurrency) https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13859780/building-a-query-using-not-exists-in-jpa-criteria-api

  • Constructor Details

    • SecuritySearchBuilder

      public SecuritySearchBuilder(Integer idWatchlist, Integer idCorrelationSet, SecuritycurrencySearch securitycurrencySearch, Integer idTenant, List<Integer> idSecurityList)
      Constructs a new SecuritySearchBuilder with the specified search parameters.
      Parameters:
      idWatchlist - the ID of a watchlist to exclude securities from, or null if not filtering by watchlist
      idCorrelationSet - the ID of a correlation set to exclude securities from, or null if not filtering by correlation set
      securitycurrencySearch - the search criteria containing various filter options (must not be null)
      idTenant - the tenant ID for privacy filtering and access control (must not be null)
      idSecurityList - specific security IDs to include, or null to search all accessible securities

  • Method Details

    • toPredicate

      public jakarta.persistence.criteria.Predicate toPredicate(jakarta.persistence.criteria.Root<Security> securityRoot, jakarta.persistence.criteria.CriteriaQuery<?> query, jakarta.persistence.criteria.CriteriaBuilder builder)
      Builds the JPA Criteria API predicate for searching securities.

      This method constructs a comprehensive compound predicate based on the provided search criteria. The filtering logic follows this priority:

      1. Exclusion filters: Excludes securities already in specified watchlist or correlation set
      2. ID list filter: Restricts to specific security IDs if provided
      3. ISIN exact match: If ISIN is provided, only this filter is applied (short-circuit)
      4. Comprehensive filtering: Applies all other criteria including derived securities, tenant privacy, name/ticker matching, connectors, currency, dates, asset class, and stock exchange

      The method uses helper methods to organize filtering logic for dates, asset classes, and stock exchanges. Multilanguage support is provided for asset class subcategories using the current user's language preference.

      Specified by:
      toPredicate in interface org.springframework.data.jpa.domain.Specification<Security>
      Parameters:
      securityRoot - the root entity for the query (Security)
      query - the criteria query being built
      builder - the criteria builder for constructing predicates and expressions
      Returns:
      a compound predicate that combines all specified search criteria with AND logic
